intro: Dianthus turcomanicus, commonly known as the Turkestan pink, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Dianthus turcomanicus is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
